intro: Dolichandrone lawii, commonly known as the Malayan dolichandrone, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has elliptical leaves with a glossy texture and is often found in tropical rainforests. It is an evergreen shrub that can grow up to 2 meters in height. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and is of interest to plant enthusiasts.
